ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got a lot better at sight reading as the quizzes/tests progressed.

I further developed my skills in reading Latin, and particular Vergils Latin poetry (which used to cause a lot more difficulty for me). I also enjoyed the supplementary readings that we did; it was interesting being able to engage with current academic scholarship in this way.
I learned how to apply translation and syntax skills to Vergils Aeneid! We also touched scanning and writing analyses.

I learned a lot about the syntactical elements of poetry. Scansion and reading were two other aspects that were totally new to me. I think I really developed my ability to sight read seen and unseen passages.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was definitely structured such that I had to prepare a lot for class. Students were cold-called to translate aloud a few verses at a time of the assigned passage. Maybe I'm especially anxious, but it was really stressful for me to translate aloud like that, especially given that I am not especially good at this course material.

Strengths: I like the subject matter
Weaknesses: Course is too demanding, too many assessments, classes can be very stressful
I think its a great course. I wouldnt change much.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Aeneid VI is pretty cool, and the quiz corrections are a lifesaver. I definitely found myself working really hard, but, despite my intentions to sail through and not absorb anything, I think I may have actually learned some Latin in the process.
No, unless youre really into Latin! Should not be taken as a language requirement if you can avoid it.
Yes. Its an intensive course where you learn to read poetry.
